result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David W. Smith

records.addlTxt: for Restitution stipulated to by the defendant and to be released forthwith

1:33 PM Attorney Drew Lehman in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant David W. Smith in court. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Victim rights compliance. DE advises the Court that he received an email from the previously assigned ADA, ADA Binger. ADA Lehman found the email and places the offer on the record. DE would like to accept the offer. Court holds colloquy with the DE; DE waives his right to an attorney and is requesting to proceed pro se. Defendant entered a plea of guilty; found guilty by the court. The State is requesting an adjourned sentencing date to be in victim rights compliance. Court orders restitution in the amount of $1,339.50; State to file restitution order.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
CSM Lema attempted to contact deft to inform him of new court date; unable to leave message.  Mailbox full.  Notice sent

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk. M.Burke. DE is not eligible for SPD and will go forward without an attorney. DE needs to get discovery and talk with the state. STC set to 09/08/22 at 1:30.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

ADDRESS INFO for David W. Smith
Current: 3411 15th St, Apt. 1A, Kenosha, WI 53144 United States  (Effective: 05-19-2022)
Prior: 6511 245th Ave, Salem, WI 53168

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with:  Josefina P-B, Taco Bell 25020 75th Street Paddock Lk.

212PM   Attorney Zachary Brost appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.   Clerk JT  Minutes:   The Court finds probable cause in this case today.   Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.   Plea of Not Guilty entered by the Court. Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 02:10 pm.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 10:00 am. $500  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event). mi
